description: Numbers n such that n^2 + (n+1)^2 + (n+2)^2 + (n+3)^2 + (n+4)^2 is palindromic.
comments: All terms are odd. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 18 2016
links: P. De Geest, Palindromic Sums of Squares of Consecutive Integers
mathematica: Select[Range[15000],PalindromeQ[5(6+4#+#^2)]&] (* The program uses the PalindromeQ function from Mathematica version 10.3 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 02 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) isok(n) = my(d = digits(n^2 + (n+1)^2 + (n+2)^2 + (n+3)^2 + (n+4)^2)); d == Vecrev(d); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 24 2016
author: _Patrick De Geest_
